title: Getting Started
text: main thesis behind published resource children adverse events drug exposure just disease process also biological processes growth development. National Institute Child Human Development defines 7 stages child development estimate signals: term neonate (0-27 days), infancy (28 days-1 years), toddler (1 year-2 years), early childhood (2-5 years), middle childhood (6-11 years), early adolescence 12-17 years, late adolescence (18-21 years). database contains tables drug safety signals drug, adverse event, biological ontologies facilitate teasing apart influences contributions adverse drug events childhood.

title: Getting Started
text: package helps identifying, retrieving, loading database. Retrieve database: Connect database: something:  labelled numbers number observed drug reports adverse event. red bars intervals estimated signal drug exposure’s effect occurrence adverse event child development stage. context, risk signal estimate synonymous - use risk model generate drug safety signals. Disconnect database: much can done data found database. Stay tuned vignettes!
code:
library(kidsides) download_sqlite_db() #downloads to cache, if not already there ## kidsides would like to download a 'sqlite' database to your cache directory at: ## /home/runner/.cache/R/kidsides. Is that okay? ##  (Yes/no/cancel) con <- connect_sqlite_db() library(dplyr) ##  ## Attaching package: 'dplyr' ## The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': ##  ##     filter, lag ## The following objects are masked from 'package:base': ##  ##     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union library(ggplot2) library(tidyr) library(stringr)  drug_ <- "montelukast; oral" event_ <- "Nightmare"  theme_big <-    theme_classic(base_size=16) +    theme(     strip.text = element_text(color="black",face="bold"),     strip.background = element_blank(),     axis.title.x = element_blank(),     axis.line = element_blank(),     axis.ticks = element_blank(),     axis.text.x = element_text(color="black",face="bold",                                angle=45,vjust=1,hjust=1),     axis.text.y = element_blank(),     axis.title.y = element_text(color="black",face="bold"),     legend.position = "top",     legend.text = element_text(color="black",face="bold"),     legend.key.size = unit(0.4,"cm"),     legend.box.margin = margin(-0.4,-0.4,0,-0.4,unit = "cm")   )  stages <-   c("term_neonatal","infancy",     "toddler","early_childhood",     "middle_childhood","early_adolescence",     "late_adolescence") stages_split <- str_replace(stages,"_","
")  plot_ade_risks <- function(x,color="red",theme=theme_big,ts=5){   x$nichd_split <- str_replace(x$nichd,"_","
")   x$NICHD = factor(x$nichd_split,levels=str_replace(stages,"_","
"))   x %>%      ggplot(aes(factor(nichd_split,levels=stages_split),gam_score,group=ade)) +     geom_bar(stat="identity",aes(y=log10(as.numeric(DE)+1)),fill="lightgray",color="black") +     ggrepel::geom_label_repel(       aes(         label=DE,         y=log10(as.numeric(DE)+1)       ),       vjust=1.3,fontface="bold",size=ts) +     geom_point(color=color,size=2) +     geom_errorbar(aes(ymin=gam_score_90mse,ymax=gam_score_90pse),                   width=0.1,color=color,linewidth=1) +     geom_hline(yintercept = 0,color="black",linewidth=0.5) +     facet_wrap(~ade_name,labeller = label_wrap_gen(width = 20)) +     xlab("") +     ylab("Risk of ADE (GAM log odds)") +      theme +     theme(       axis.line = element_line(),       axis.ticks = element_line(),       axis.text.y = element_text(color="black",face="bold",size=12)     )    }  tbl(con,"ade_nichd") %>%      filter(ade_name==paste0(drug_," and ",event_)) %>%      collect() %>%      plot_ade_risks() disconnect_sqlite_db(con)

title: Download, Cache, and Connect to KidSIDES
Download, Cache, and Connect to KidSIDES
text: R data package contains observation, summary, model-level data pediatric drug safety research developed Nicholas Giangreco PhD dissertation Tatonetti lab Columbia University. database comprised 17 tables including table descriptions fields table. main table, ade_nichd, contains quantitative data nearly 500,000 pediatric drug safety signals across 7 child development stages spanning birth late adolescence (21 years age). database created using methods analyses references. data resource can used CC 4.0 license agreement.

title: Download, Cache, and Connect to KidSIDES
code: library(dplyr) ##  ## Attaching package: 'dplyr'  ## The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': ##  ##     filter, lag  ## The following objects are masked from 'package:base': ##  ##     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union library(kidsides) kidsides::download_sqlite_db() ## Attempt failed to check sqlite exists or to download from the URL: https://tlab-kidsides.s3.amazonaws.com/data/effect_peds_19q2_v0.3_20211119.sqlite.gz con <- kidsides::connect_sqlite_db()  DBI::dbListTables(con) ##  [1] "ade"                                            ##  [2] "ade_nichd"                                      ##  [3] "ade_nichd_enrichment"                           ##  [4] "ade_null"                                       ##  [5] "ade_null_distribution"                          ##  [6] "ade_raw"                                        ##  [7] "atc_raw_map"                                    ##  [8] "cyp_gene_expression_substrate_risk_information" ##  [9] "dictionary"                                     ## [10] "drug"                                           ## [11] "drug_gene"                                      ## [12] "event"                                          ## [13] "gene"                                           ## [14] "gene_expression"                                ## [15] "grip"                                           ## [16] "ryan"                                           ## [17] "sider" dplyr::tbl(con,"dictionary") %>%      dplyr::collect() ## # A tibble: 152 × 4 ##    table field             description                                     type  ##    <chr> <chr>             <chr>                                           <chr> ##  1 drug  atc_concept_id    The ATC 5th level OMOP concept identifier.      int   ##  2 drug  atc_concept_name  The ATC 5th level OMOP concept name. In the ad… char… ##  3 drug  atc_concept_code  The ATC 5th level OMOP concept code.            char… ##  4 drug  ndrugreports      The number of reports of the drug in Pediatric… int   ##  5 drug  atc4_concept_name The ATC 4th level OMOP concept name.            char… ##  9 drug  atc2_concept_name The ATC 2nd level OMOP concept name.            char… ## 10 drug  atc2_concept_code The ATC 2nd level OMOP concept code.            char… ## # … with 142 more rows dplyr::tbl(con,"ade_nichd") %>%      dplyr::collect() ## title: Download, Cache, and Connect to KidSIDES
text: Adverse drug reactions leading cause morbidity mortality costs billions dollars healthcare system. children, increased risk adverse drug reactions potentially lasting adverse effects adulthood. current pediatric drug safety landscape, including clinical trials, limited rarely includes children relies extrapolation adults. Children small adults go evolutionarily conserved physiologically dynamic process growth maturation. hypothesize adverse drug reactions manifest interaction drug exposure dynamic biological processes child growth development. hypothesize developing statistical methodologies prior knowledge dynamic, shared information development, can improve detection adverse drug events children. data package downloads SQLite database created applying covariate-adjusted disproportionality generalized additive models (dGAMs) systematic way develop resource nearly half million adverse drug event (ADE) risk estimates across child development stages.

title: Download, Cache, and Connect to KidSIDES
text: observation-level data, case reports drug(s) potentially linked adverse event(s), collected Food Drug Administration Adverse Event System (FAERS) US. data publicly available openFDA platform downloadable json files. However, utilizing data -non-trivial, drug event report data published chunks nested json structure quarter per year since 1990s. API key extended permissions, developed custom python notebooks scripts available ‘openFDA_drug_event-parsing’ github repository (DOI: https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.4464544) extract format drug event reports prior third quarter 2019. observation-level data used, called Pediatric FAERS, downstream analyses stored table ade_raw.

title: Download the Pediatric Drug Safety database — download_sqlite_db
text: method method download sqlite database. See download.file quiet Whether download quietly. See download.file timeout Extended download session downloading file. Default 1000 seconds. force Whether force download database. Defaults FALSE.
